Comments_List: I developed a much more thorough understanding of canonical figures within the history of political thought
This has been a fantastic in-depth analysis of three incredibly important political theorists.
I think the course is very well-structured. The one thing I'd mention as a weakness is it wasn't always clear how relevant the secondary material was.

While incredibly engaging and stimulating, this course at time suffered from a lack of organizational structure. Readings, though advertised as posted on canvas, were often posted only a day or two before the meeting of the class, and the syllabus did not always adequately clarify what, exactly, the assigned reading was. Additionally, communication outside of class was at times difficult. That being said, these were minor inconveniences in an otherwise fantastic course.

Yes, I definitely would. If you have any intention on grappling with someone like Hegel, you'll want to take this course with Professor Oskian. She does a great job of unpacking oftentimes obscure arguments without sacrificing their profundity.
